page.title: 19Banstead & Perrotts Wood
page.content: Banstead and Perrotts Woods are nature reserves which cover nearly 500 acres. In the centre there is the hospital but it was previously the estate of the Gaton family. Another 55 acres called Fames Rough, are owned by Surrey County Council and are of scientific interest, but they are managed like the whole estate by Reigate and Banstead Council. Some land is let for agricultural purposes. A field in Holly Lane is occupied by horses. Banstead car park and entry to the area are both free. About three hundred acres of the estate are woodland with tens of thousands of trees, perhaps as many as fifty thousand, including Silver Birch, Douglas and other Firs, Copper Beech, Red and Common Oak, Hazel, Wild Cherry, Yew, Holly, Horse Chestnut, Hornbeam and many others.
